item.title: BEAST and the BEAST basics: molecular clocks and how to input rates into BEAST
item.description: BEAST basics **A brief introduction to BEAST ** BEAST is a powerful computer program for evolutionary analysis developed by Andrew Rambaut and Alexei Drummond, as well as Marc Suchard, Simon Ho, Joseph Heled, and others. BEAST was originally designed to provide a Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) method for simultaneously co-estimating phylogenies and divergence times (times to the most recent common ancestor, TMRCAs) from DNA sequence data (or amino acids) for one or multiple loci.
